attributes.action: investigate fully the effects that modern Navy sonar equipment have upon sea life, to make all results of such investigations - both new and existing - available to the public and cease the use of such equipment should the results show any detrimental effects to sea life.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With the shocking mass-strandings of dolphins on the Cornish coast on 9th June 2008, the issue of the potential dangers of modern sonar has again been highlighted.

The question must be asked as to whether strong modern sonar equipment is causing harm to sea life - particularly cetaceans.  There are many instances that suggest it is.

Whales and dolphins rely on their own form of sonar for much of their existence.  The system is highly developed and highly sensitive.  It is obvious, therefore, that extreme intensities of artificial sonar within their environment are likely to interfere with the natural mechanisms of the animals.

Not only is it likely to cause confusion, but more importantly, severe pain and suffering as well… enough to drive the creatures - in extreme panic - into shallow waters to die.

It is, therefore, vitally important that the proper research is conducted to determine the type and degree of effects that man-made sonar cause.

As technology advances, it is imperative that sonar development carries the safety of sea life and non-interference within the underwater environment as its highest priority.

Please add you name to this petition.  Action MUST be taken.
